intro: Conyza sumatrensis var. leiotheca, commonly known as the whiteleaf fleabane, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural and urban environments.
